judgment_text:
IN THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY
ORDINARY ORIGINAL CIVIL JURISDICTION 
CONTEMPT PETITION NO. 13 OF 2006
IN
 WRIT PETITION NO. 2002 OF 1988
Smt. Vandana widow of
late Dattaram Dadu Bhogale
 ..Petitioner
v/s.
Shri Babaji Sahadev Kesarkar & Anr.
..Respondents
Shri A.M. Ranpise for Petitioner.
R.A. Thorat i/b
P.J. Thorat for Respondent No. 1.
P.G. Sawant, AGP for Respondent No. 2.
 CORAM : S. K. SHAH, J.
 DATE : 28th April, 2006.
P.C.
The order of which the contempt is alleged is clause (1) of
the Minutes of the Order in respect of which order dated 2nd August
was passed. Clause 1 speaks of temporary alternate
accommodation on getting of which the Petitioner and the Respondent
were to stay together as per the undertaking given by the Respondent
who was the petitioner in the writ petition. Learned counsel for the
Respondent states that he has not obtained the possession of the
temporary accommodation but he is ready to have the permanent
accommodation. The grievance of the petitioner is that she is not
allowed to occupy the permanent accommodation. Therefore he cannot
take care of her. The matter has been complied in terms of the
undertaking given. The contempt petition therefore does not lie. It is
therefore dismissed. 
 
 (S. K. SHAH, J)
